content.raw:
That would be a great addition, but sounds like a lot of work. Wouldn't it be easier to convert the values to some standard units instead (minutes to seconds, etc.)?
Because in my mind the most common reason why we need this is that we often compare values between different files, and they may be in different units. Simple conversion without any subclassing would solve this. Do you have other use cases in mind?
Also, what happens with the current checks for `'type'`?
Finally, what kind of functionality do you intend to add? Is it only unit metadata attributes or do you mean to write converters, too?
